term.name: subjectivism
term.source: From Latin subjectum: the subject or self that is the seat of consciousness.
term.def: Any doctrine (opposed to &objectivism; and &realism;) claiming that truth or value is relative to or dependent on the consciousness of the individual, and thus not objective. In general, subjectivism is a personalized form of &relativism; that in its most radical forms borders on &emotionalism;, &irrationalism;, or even &solipsism;.
